title: How to Draw a 3D Box

steps.headline: Get blank sheet of paper.
steps.description: Any type will do, but if you're starting as beginner, graph paper is best.

steps.headline: Get a pencil.
steps.description: With a pencil, you can erase any mistakes.

steps.headline: Draw a rectangle or square using the boxes.
steps.description: Make sure you only draw on the line to make sure it's straight.

steps.headline: Draw the exact same rectangle behind the first one.
steps.description: The higher or lower you put it, the longer your box will be.

steps.headline: Draw two lines connecting the two bottom corners.
steps.description: This will be the bottom of your box.

steps.headline: Draw two lines connecting the two top corners.
steps.description: This is the top of your box.

methods.name: Drawing a 3D box that isn't see-through

steps.headline: Get blank sheet of paper.
steps.description: Any type will do, but if you're starting as beginner, graph paper is best.

steps.headline: Get a pencil.
steps.description: With a pencil, you can erase any mistakes.

steps.headline: Draw a rectangle or square using the boxes.
steps.description: Make sure you only draw on the line to make sure it's straight.

steps.headline: Draw one line slanting upwards.
steps.description: This is the bottom side of your box.

steps.headline: Draw two lines slanting upwards on the top.
steps.description:
This is the top of the box. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/d\/df\/Bod3743728.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/d\/df\/Bod3743728.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":460,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":760,"licensing":"

tyn: Straight edge (a ruler is good to get congruent lines.)
text:
Drawing a see through 3D box Get blank sheet of paper. Any type will do, but if you're starting as beginner, graph paper is best. Get a pencil. With a pencil, you can erase any mistakes. Draw a rectangle or square using the boxes. Make sure you only draw on the line to make sure it's straight. Draw the exact same rectangle behind the first one. The higher or lower you put it, the longer your box will be. Draw two lines connecting the two bottom corners. This will be the bottom of your box. Draw two lines connecting the two top corners. This is the top of your box. Finished! Drawing a 3D box that isn't see-through Get blank sheet of paper. Any type will do, but if you're starting as beginner, graph paper is best. Get a pencil. With a pencil, you can erase any mistakes. Draw a rectangle or square using the boxes. Make sure you only draw on the line to make sure it's straight. Draw one line slanting upwards. This is the bottom side of your box. Draw two lines slanting upwards on the top. This is the top of the box. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/d\/df\/Bod3743728.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/d\/df\/Bod3743728.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":460,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":760,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Connect the remaining lines. Finished!
sentences: Drawing a see through 3D box Get blank sheet of paper.
Any type will do, but if you're starting as beginner, graph paper is best.
Get a pencil.
With a pencil, you can erase any mistakes.
Draw a rectangle or square using the boxes.
Make sure you only draw on the line to make sure it's straight.
Draw the exact same rectangle behind the first one.
The higher or lower you put it, the longer your box will be.
Draw two lines connecting the two bottom corners.
This will be the bottom of your box.
Draw two lines connecting the two top corners.
This is the top of your box.
Finished!
Drawing a 3D box that isn't see-through Get blank sheet of paper.
Any type will do, but if you're starting as beginner, graph paper is best.
Get a pencil.
With a pencil, you can erase any mistakes.
Draw a rectangle or square using the boxes.
Make sure you only draw on the line to make sure it's straight.
Draw one line slanting upwards.
This is the bottom side of your box.
Draw two lines slanting upwards on the top.
This is the top of the box.
